        public static boolean test(Vector a,
                           Vector b)
        Tests whether two points collide. This is equivalent to testing whether the two points are in the same position.
        Parameters:
        a - the first point
        b - the second point
        Returns:
        whether the points collide

        public static float rayCast(Ray ray,

                     throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Throws:

      • rayCast

        public static float rayCast(Ray a,
                            Ray b)
        Tests where two Rays collide.

        The returned value is a multiplier for the directional vector of the ray at which the ray and the other object collide with each other.

        The point of the collision can be obtained by setting the length of the first ray to that multiplier using Ray.setLength(float).
        Parameters:
        a - the first ray
        b - the second ray
        Returns:
        the ray multiplier or Float.NaN

      • rayCast

        public static float rayCast(Ray ray,
                            Vector point)
        Tests where a Ray and a Point (Vector) collide.

        The returned value is a multiplier for the directional vector of the ray at which the ray and the other object collide with each other.

        The point of the collision can be obtained by setting the length of the first ray to that multiplier using Ray.setLength(float).
        Parameters:
        ray - the ray
        point - the point
        Returns:
        where the ray and the point collide or Float.NaN

      • rayCast

        public static float rayCast(Ray ray,
                            Sphere sphere)
        Tests where a Ray and a Sphere collide.

        The returned value is a multiplier for the directional vector of the ray at which the ray and the other object collide with each other.

        The point of the collision can be obtained by setting the length of the first ray to that multiplier using Ray.setLength(float).
        Parameters:
        ray - the ray
        sphere - the sphere
        Returns:
        where the ray and the point collide or Float.NaN

        Parameters:

        box - the bounding box
        Returns:
        where the box and the point collide or Float.NaN
